text: Erigeron porsildii is an Arctic species of flowering plant in the daisy family known by the common name Porsild's Arctic fleabane. It has been found in Alaska, Yukon, and the Northwest Territories. Erigeron porsildii is a perennial herb up to 25 centimeters (10 inches) tall, spreading by means of underground rhizomes. Leaves and stems are covered with many hairs The plant generally produces only one flower head per stem. Each head has 65–110 blue, lavender, or white ray florets surrounding numerous yellow disc florets. The species grows on cliffs, talus, gravel, and dry tundra.Flora of North America, Erigeron porsildii G. L. Nesom & D. F. Murray, 2004.
